p: The great majority of acute asthma exacerbations in children and a considerable proportion in adults is preceded by a viral URT infection. Such exacerbations may often result in hospitalization. The most frequently isolated offending agent is RV, a fact that reflects the preponderance of the virus among common cold cases. Finally, exacerbations of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease may also have a viral etiology, most commonly due to RVs.
